item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind." -- Montaigne

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description: "The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books." -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Lyndon Baines Johnson
item.description: "Books and ideas are the most effective weapons against intolerance and ignorance." -- Lyndon Baines Johnson

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If animals could speak, the dog would be a blundering outspoken fellow; but the cat would have the rare grace of never saying a word too much." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There are many humorous things in the world; among them, the white man's notion that he is less savage than the other savages." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Oprah Winfrey
item.description: "Turn your wounds into wisdom." -- Oprah Winfrey

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by John Locke
item.description: "New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not common." -- John Locke

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "I think it's perfectly possible to explain how the universe came about without bringing God into it, but I don't know everything, and there may well be a God somewhere, hiding away. Actually, if he is keeping out of sight, it's because he's ashamed of his followers and all the cruelty and ignorance they're responsible for promoting in his name. If I were him, I'd want nothing to do with them." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Bcornies add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "Do not believe in anything simply because you have heard it. Do not believe in anything simply because it is spoken and rumored by many. Do not believe in anything simply because it is found written in your religious books. Do not believe in anything merely on the authority of your teachers and elders. Do not believe in traditions because they have been handed down for many generations. But after observation and analysis, when you find that anything agrees with reason and is conducive to the good and benefit of one and all, then accept it and live up to it." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
